answers.answer: Hi.When did you first notice this? Do you also drink a lot of fluids? When you urinate, is the amount normal or reduced? Is there always output of urine or do you only get the urge to urinate?Frequent urination can be caused by a lot of conditions, including urinary tract infections, bladder conditions such as interstitial cystitis, nephritis, benign prostatic hyperplasia, and some metabolic conditions such as diabetes mellitus or diabetes insipidus.You should have your symptoms evaluated by a physician.Good luck.

Hi,You need to get a clinical evaluation done to rule out diabetes because frequent urination could be caused due to that. Do you have any other symptoms? Is there burning sensation while passing urine? What is your age? You could also be having urinary tract infection. Consult your physician for a confirmed diagnosis.

question: I have frequent uriniation there is no blood in the urine no infections at all.Is frequency urination a sign of bladder cancer the only sympton I get is urinate every hour of the day it doesn't wake me up at nite.It's very annoying...
title: what is the chances it could be?
